author: Lesley Waters
method: For the snapper, heat a griddle pan until smoking. Rub the snapper fillet with oil and season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place the snapper onto the hot griddle and char-grill for two minutes on each side, or until cooked through. To make the pineapple salsa, place all of the salsa ingredients into a large bowl and mix together well. To serve, place the salsa in the centre of a plate with the snapper fillet on top and garnish with the salad onions.
